New Records: LeBron James is the oldest player in NBA history to record back-to-back games with 20+ points and 10+ assists
Others: The Lakers suffered a surprising 115-103 loss to the Pistons, falling to 4-3 in their first seven games of the new season. LeBron James finished with 20 points, eight rebounds, 11 assists and two steals while shooting 7/16 from the field and 1/2 from the three-point range in 40 minutes. The Lakers will play their next game on Wednesday evening when they visit the Memphis Grizzlies, and then return home to host the Philadelphia 76ers on Friday. The Pistons improved to 3-5 in their first eight games following the Lakers game.
